definition: to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)

sentences.english: Nobody would love god or his neighbour unless he can gaurantee enough food.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人能餓着肚子敬奉上帝或熱愛他的鄰居。

sentences.english: No one can worship God or love his neighbor on an empty stomach.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人能餓着肚子敬奉上帝或熱愛他的鄰居。

definition: to consecrate/to enshrine and worship/an offering (to one's ancestors)/a sacrifice (to a God)
to respect a deity/to pray to a God
to believe in (a deity or other supernatural being)/to worship
to worship/to pay respects to (a deity, ancestor etc)/(of a shrine or temple) to be dedicated to (a deity, ancestor etc)
the three sacrificial animals (originally cow, sheep and pig; later pig, chicken and fish)
to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to offer sacrifices to the gods
